Sentencas: Ammonia appears to be a promising fuel for solid oxide fuel cell systems: it is a carbon-free species, can be stored easily and offers an excellent energy density with a high hydrogen content.
Titulo: Characterization and performance evaluation of ammonia as fuel for solid oxide fuel cells with Ni/YSZ anodes

Sentencas: This work shows comprehensive investigations of the direct operation of ammonia on an industrial-sized solid oxide fuel cell with Ni/YSZ anode.
Titulo: Characterization and performance evaluation of ammonia as fuel for solid oxide fuel cells with Ni/YSZ anodes

Sentencas: In the course of this study, ammonia exhibited excellent performance as a fuel for solid oxide fuel cells, although test results equivalent to those of hydrogen/nitrogen fuel mixtures were not attained.
Titulo: Characterization and performance evaluation of ammonia as fuel for solid oxide fuel cells with Ni/YSZ anodes

Sentencas: Electrochemical impedance spectroscopy proved the reduced performance output of ammonia as fuel to result from its endothermic decomposition.
Titulo: Characterization and performance evaluation of ammonia as fuel for solid oxide fuel cells with Ni/YSZ anodes

Sentencas: This significantly increased the ohmic resistance, which is mainly influenced by the ammonia flow rate.
Titulo: Characterization and performance evaluation of ammonia as fuel for solid oxide fuel cells with Ni/YSZ anodes

Sentencas: Operation in counter-flow is more favorable than in co-flow, as lower ohmic and diffusion resistances were measured.
Titulo: Characterization and performance evaluation of ammonia as fuel for solid oxide fuel cells with Ni/YSZ anodes

Sentencas: Twenty-four-hour stability tests showed stable behavior at 800 degrees C and a voltage decrease of 2% at 700 degrees C. Investigations of the anode micro-structure suggest that nickel nitriding occurred, as microscopic pores, particle enlargements, and agglomerations were identified at the metallic parts.
Titulo: Characterization and performance evaluation of ammonia as fuel for solid oxide fuel cells with Ni/YSZ anodes
